results.title: The Making of a mural (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The work of Thomas Hart Benson, one of America’s modern painters, is studied in detail as he executes a 22 ft mural entitled “Achelous and Hercules” in a Kansas City women’s store. The process of making a mural is followed from the time of the artist’s original conception of the subject until the mural is completed on the walls.

results.title: The Making of a gallery
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: This film recounts the early history of Victoria’s National Gallery, and illustrates the important role of the Felton Bequest, established in 1904, in laying the foundations for the gallery’s collection, and depicts some of the principal masterpieces. Finally Eric Westbrook, the gallery director, talks about the need for a new gallery, and architect Roy Grounds, discusses his aims in the design of the Arts Centre. Photographed by Nigel Buesst, music by George Dreyfus and written by Tim Burstall.

results.title: The Making of a documentary
results.brief_description: Television documentaries have long been a part of public service and information programs of major network and local TV stations. How such films are made is the engrossing subject of this film, using as an example the CBS News show, “The Catholic Dilemma”.

results.title: The Making of 'Raiders of the lost ark'
results.brief_description: Using many extracts from the film “Raiders of the lost ark”, and selections from seventy hours of production footage, this documentary covers key aspects of the production of the film, with special emphasis on Spielberg’s use of storyboards in conferences with his art and set designers, performers and crew. Includes interviews with stars Harrison Ford and Karen Allen, Spielberg and stuntman Harry Leonard. Phtographed and edited by Phillip Schuman and narrated by Scott Beach. Suitable for Years 7-12.

results.title: The Making of 'Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid'
results.creator_credit: George Roy Hill, Ronald Preissman and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Traces the development of the major scenes in the feature film, “Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid”, showing sets, staging of action and casting of characters. Paul Newman, Robert Redford and director George Roy Hill comment on personal relationships between actors and directors. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Majority Retreat (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Facing Racism at Work. Nine trigger episodes of 2 minutes each look at issues associated with selection, acceptance and promotion. It covers discrimination in job selection, acceptance and promotion, based on the premise that racism is prejudice plus power. Designed for employees and managers.

results.title: The Major religions
results.creator_credit: Warren P. Everote and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: An objective survey of the origins, rituals and symbols of the major religions of the world - namely, Hinduism, Buddhism, Judaism, Christianity and Islam. The film is designed to help inspire an appreciation for, and a tolerance of, the principal religious faiths held by most of the world’s people.

results.title: The Maitland and Morpeth String Quartet
results.creator_credit: Anne Jolliffe, Australian Film Commission and Jollification
results.brief_description: Maitland and its sleepy neighbour, Morpeth, are never quite the same again, all due to a middle-aged couple and their hobby of violin playing. This animated film is a delight to both eye and ear. Victoria Robert’s quirky cartoons are perfect complements for Nick Enright’s cleverly constructed poem, while Ruth Cracknell’s reading of all parts adds wit and charm. An animated film by Jollification.

results.title: The Mailu story (told by Sister Clark)
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Presents life in the Mailu Islands of South-East Papua New Guinea where a nurse for the London Missionary Society works among the people. Visits a Papuan church service, after a canoe trip through the coral islands, seeing the skilful fishermen. When serious illness occurs, isolation is felt until help comes by radio and seaplane. Shows old customs continuing such as tattooing, feasts, pot-making. Narrated by Sister Clark.
